article.title: Many body localization with long range interactions

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (6) defines several parameters. What physical quantities do  $U_q$, $K_q$ and $V_q$ represent in the context of the bosonized Hamiltonian?
choices: $U_q$: Plasmon frequency,  $K_q$: Interaction strength, $V_q$: Fermi velocity
$U_q$: Fermi velocity,  $K_q$: Luttinger parameter, $V_q$: Interaction strength
$U_q$: Interaction strength,  $K_q$: Fermi velocity, $V_q$: Plasmon frequency
$U_q$: Fermi velocity,  $K_q$: Plasmon frequency, $V_q$: Interaction strength

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (12) provides an expression for λ. What does λ represent in this context?
choices: The average distance between impurities in the system
The energy scale associated with the long-range interaction
The localization length of the low-lying excited states
The wavelength of the photon mode in the superconducting phase

multiple_choice_question.text: The article discusses a scenario where superconductivity enables MBL. Which equation describes the effective theory of a superconductor minimally coupled to a gauge field?
The article mentions that in three dimensions, vortices in a superconductor are line-like objects. Why does this pose a challenge for demonstrating their localization?
choices: Line-like objects cannot be localized in principle.
The interactions between line-like objects are always long-ranged.
The presence of even a single delocalized vortex destroys MBL.
The arguments based on [3], which deals with point-like excitations, cannot be directly applied.
